title: GOES-U nears launch with a new sun sensor
summary: The primary difference between the geostationary weather satellite scheduled to launch June 25 and its predecessors is its solar-viewing instrument.

title: NASA Invites Public to Share Excitement of NOAA GOES-U Launch
summary: NASA invites the public to participate in virtual activities and events leading up to the launch of the NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) GOES-U (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite-U) mission.  NASA is targeting a two-hour window opening at 5:16 p.m. EDT Tuesday, June 25, for the launch of the weather satellite aboard a SpaceX Falcon […]

title: Final GOES-R Satellite Ready to Fly
summary: NASA and NOAA are preparing to launch GOES-U, the last of the four GOES-R series geostationary weather satellites on June 25th, 2024 at 5:16PM, Eastern Time atop a SpaceX Falcon Heavy.

title: Rocket Report: Electron turns 50, China’s Moon launcher breathes fire
summary: "Most rocket startups are still stuck in the long process of reengineering."

title: NASA Sets Launch Coverage for NOAA Weather Satellite
summary: NASA will provide live coverage of prelaunch and launch activities for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) GOES-U (Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite U) mission. The two-hour launch window opens at 5:16 p.m. EDT Tuesday, June 25, for the satellite’s launch on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket from Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space […]

title: NOAA might revise geostationary weather satellite timeline
summary: High demand for space weather data is prompting the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to consider revising the schedule for its next geostationary weather satellite constellation.

title: Rocket Report: Virgin Galactic delays flight, Falcon Heavy nets NASA mission
summary: "There was a large bang and some white smoke went up."

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy launch contracts reach double digits after latest NASA win
summary: For the third time in seven months, NASA has contracted SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket to launch a high-value scientific spacecraft, raising the...

title: SpaceX wins contract to launch weather satellite after ULA withdraws
summary: NASA has selected SpaceX to launch the last in a series of geostationary weather satellites that had previously been launched by United Launch Alliance.

title: NASA Awards Launch Services Contract for GOES-U Mission
summary: NASA has selected Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX) of Hawthorne, California, to provide launch services for the Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite-U (GOES-U) mission.
